text: William Patrick "W. P." Kinsella (May 25, 1935September 16, 2016) was a Canadian novelist and short story writer. He was known for his novel Shoeless Joe (1982), which was made into the movie Field of Dreams in 1989. Kinsella died by euthanasia in Hope, British Columbia on September 16, 2016 at the age of 81.Obituary , MontrealGazette.com; retrieved September 17, 2016. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Canadian novelists Category:People from Edmonton Category:Deaths by euthanasia
title: W. P. Kinsella
